properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 2 at 12:41PM MST until February 3 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Riverton WY
properties.description:
...Major Winter Storm is expected through Monday Night...

.A cold front move southward through Wyoming into tonight. The
snow is expected to spread from the north this afternoon and
spread south tonight. This storm system will impact most areas
through Monday evening, then taper off late Monday night. The
heaviest snowfall looks to occur tonight through Monday morning.

* WHAT...Moderate to Heavy snow.

* WHERE...Absaroka Mountains and Cody Foothills.

* WHEN...Through 11 PM MST Monday. The heaviest snow is expected
tonight into early Monday.

* SNOW AMOUNTS...6 to 11 inches in the Cody Foothills and 8 to
15 inches in the Absaroka Mountains. Locally higher snowfall
totals may occur.

* IMPACTS...Travel may be very difficult tonight through Monday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of north wind 15 to 25 mph will
cause some blowing and drifting snow.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST MONDAY
